senses.sense_definition: The final result or consequence of an event or enterprise.

examples.text: The <w>offcome</w> of the long negotiations was finally announced today.
We waited anxiously to see what the <w>offcome</w> of the battle would be.

traits.comment: largely replaced by 'outcome' in modern English

senses.sense_definition: An apology or explanation offered as a justification.

examples.text: He offered a poor <w>offcome</w> for his lateness, which no one believed.
She had a ready <w>offcome</w> whenever she was caught making a mistake.

senses.sense_definition: A way of escaping a difficult situation using a trick or pretext.

examples.text: The politician sought a clever <w>offcome</w> to avoid answering the question directly.
There was no easy <w>offcome</w> from the complicated trap he had set for himself.

senses.sense_definition: That which is emitted or the act of separating from a surface.

examples.text: The dense <w>offcome</w> of sparks from the fire illuminated the dark room.
Scientists analyzed the chemical <w>offcome</w> produced by the reaction.

senses.sense_definition: A sudden display of bad temper or anger.

examples.text: His sudden <w>offcome</w> shocked everyone at the dinner table.
She later apologized for her violent <w>offcome</w> during the argument.
